intro: Senecio catamarcensis, commonly known as the Catamarcensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, exhibiting adaptations to withstand drought conditions. Its foliage is usually gray-green, with hairy surfaces that help reduce water loss. Senecio catamarcensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in environments with low rainfall.
